meanings.definition: A person or thing that makes something plump or fuller in appearance.
meanings.sent1: The baker used a plumper to fill the pastries with cream.
meanings.sent2: The plumper added extra stuffing to the pillows for more comfort.
meanings.sent3: The plumper in the garden gnome costume made everyone laugh at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a plumper, filling the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The plumper of the paintbrush made the strokes bold and vibrant.

meanings.definition: To make something plump or fuller in appearance.
meanings.sent1: She decided to plumper the cushions on the couch for a cozier feel.
meanings.sent2: The chef used extra butter to plumper the mashed potatoes.
meanings.sent3: He tried to plumper his excuses with unnecessary details.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to plumper her face with happiness.
meanings.sent5: The rain helped plumper the fruits on the trees, making them juicier.

meanings.definition: Having a full or rounded shape.
meanings.sent1: The plumper pumpkin won first prize at the fair.
meanings.sent2: Her cheeks had a plumper appearance after eating the delicious meal.
meanings.sent3: The plumper clouds in the sky looked like fluffy cotton candy.
meanings.sent4: The plumper balloons floated gracefully in the air at the party.
meanings.sent5: The plumper cushions on the sofa made it more comfortable to sit on.
